DVD quality, never a bluray rip in a million years. Dark sections of the movie are all pixals and light parts are very grainy indeed. Try another if you want a BDrip guys!

5amjr: The "brrip" tag just indicates the source, not the quality.  The info clearly states that the video is 624x256, which obviously isn't HD.  But given the same encoding settings, a brrip at that resolution will likely look better than a dvdrip of the same resolution because of the higher quality source.  Don't complain that something isn't high def when it's clearly not described as such.
